content: सारंग {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (गी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [सारं अंगमस्य शकं°] Spotted, variegated. --गः {@--1@} The variegated colour. {@--2@} The spotted deer, an antelope; एष राजेव दुष्यंतः सारंगेणातिरंहसा <ls>Ś. 1. 5.</ls> {@--3@} A deer in general; सारंगास्ते जललवमुचः सूचयिष्यंति मार्गं <ls>Me. 21</ls> (where it is preferable to take this sense rather than that of ‘elephant’ or ‘bee’). {@--4@} A lion. {@--5@} An elephant. {@--6@} A large black bee. {@--7@} The cuckoo. {@--8@} A large crane. {@--9@} The flamingo. {@--10@} A peacock. {@--11@} An umbrella. {@--12@} A cloud. {@--13@} A garment. {@--14@} Hair. {@--15@} A conch-shell. {@--16@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--17@} The god of love. {@--18@} A lotus. {@--19@} Camphor. {@--20@} A bow. {@--21@} Sandal. {@--22@} A kind of musical instrument. {@--23@} An ornament. {@--24@} Gold. {@--25@} The earth. {@--26@} The Cātaka bird. {@--27@} A flower. {@--28@} Night. {@--29@} Light.
